intro: Kutchubaea montana, commonly known as the mountain kutchubaea, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other ornamental plants. The plant is characterized by its attractive, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink and yellow. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Kutchubaea montana is well adapted to dry and rocky environments, making it a hardy species suitable for arid landscapes.
